SourceProxy.label: Extract Cells By Region
SourceProxy.name: ExtractGeometry

Documentation.long_help: This filter extracts cells that are inside/outside a region or at a region boundary.
Documentation.short_help: Extract cells that are inside/outside a region or at a region boundary.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter extracts from its input dataset all cells that are either completely inside or outside of a specified region (implicit function). On output, the filter generates an unstructured grid. To use this filter you must specify a region (implicit function). You must also specify whether to extract cells lying inside or outside of the region. An option exists to extract cells that are neither inside or outside (i.e., boundary).

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Slice filter.

ProxyProperty.label: Intersect With
ProxyProperty.name: ImplicitFunction
ProxyProperty.Documentation: This property sets the region used to extract cells.

IntVectorProperty.label: Extraction Side
IntVectorProperty.name: ExtractInside
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This parameter controls whether to extract cells that are inside or outside the region.

IntVectorProperty.name: Extract only intersected
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This parameter controls whether to extract only cells that are on the boundary of the region. If this parameter is set, the Extraction Side parameter is ignored. If Extract Intersected is off, this parameter has no effect.

IntVectorProperty.name: Extract intersected
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This parameter controls whether to extract cells that are on the boundary of the region.

SourceProxy.name: ExtractTimeSteps
SourceProxy.label: Extract Time Steps
SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter extracts specified time steps from its input.

IntVectorProperty.name: SelectionMode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
Extract time steps supports two ways to select the time steps to be extracted:
- **Select Time Steps**: Specify time steps to be extracted by their index
- **Select Time Range**: Specify the start and end time steps of a range by their index and optionally specify a stride to optionally take every nth timestep in the range.

IntVectorProperty.label: Time Step Indices
IntVectorProperty.name: TimeStepIndices
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the indices of the time steps to extract.

IntVectorProperty.name: TimeStepRange
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Select the beginning and end indices of the range of timesteps to extract.

IntVectorProperty.name: TimeStepInterval
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Select the stride to use when extracting the range of time steps (the n in every nth timestep).

IntVectorProperty.name: ApproximationMode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the scene's time does not match the time in any of the timesteps selected (likely because something else in the scene has time steps at different times) this setting controls which timestep should be returned by the filter. The options are the previous time step, the nearest time step and the next time step.

SourceProxy.name: ExtractParticlesOverTime
SourceProxy.label: Extract Particles Over Time

Documentation.short_help: Extract particles that pass through a volume over time.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter extracts input particles passing through a volume by iterating over time. The filter has two inputs: Particles and Volume. The Particles input should contain points evolving over time and the Volume input is expected to be a volumetric dataset. The output is a subset of the particles from the input, still temporal.

InputProperty.name: Particles
InputProperty.Documentation: The moving particles. This input should be temporal vtkDataSet and should contain points evolving over time.

InputProperty.name: Volume
InputProperty.Documentation: The volumetric data to detect if particles pass through. This dataset should contain volumetric cells like hexahedrons or tetrahedrons.

StringVectorProperty.name: IdChannelArray
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify the name of a scalar array which will be used to fetch the index of each point. This is necessary only if the particles change position (Id order) on each time step. The Id can be used to identify particles at each step and hence track them properly. If this array is set to "Global or Local IDs", the global point ids are used if they exist. Otherwise, the point indices are used.

WarnOnCreate.Text: **Extract Particles Over Time** filter needs to process all timesteps available in your dataset and can potentially take a long time to complete. Do you want to continue?
